intro: Castilleja hyetophila, commonly known as the rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and along stream banks. Its flowers are usually red or orange, with tubular shapes that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Castilleja hyetophila has a short lifespan, often blooming only once before dying, making it a rare and ephemeral species.
